item.title: This Nifty 'Notes' App Is Available to Install as a Snap Package - OMG! Ubuntu!
item.description:
This Nifty 'Notes' App Is Available to Install as a Snap Package - OMG! Ubuntu!

Remember that nifty OS X inspired Notes app we wrote about a few months back? Whether you do or you don't, if you're running Ubuntu 16.04 LTS it's now super easy to install. Notes is now available as a Snap, the new Ubuntu package format installed by default in the latest long-term support release.

item.title: How Long Will Desktop Linux Last?
item.description:
How Long Will Desktop Linux Last?

I've been a desktop Linux user for seventeen years. For eight of those years, I haven't had a copy of Windows installed on any machine in the house. Under the circumstances, I can easily drift into thinking that Linux and free software represent the whole of computing, and possibly its future as well.

item.title: Threaded Input Has Been Revised Again For The X.Org Server - Phoronix
item.description:
Threaded Input Has Been Revised Again For The X.Org Server - Phoronix

Going back six years has been work on bringing threaded input to the X.Org Server whereby the input event code would run on its own CPU thread. The work has yet to be merged in full, but Keith Packard has now revised the patches.

item.title: Plasma 5.6 Makes KDE Plasma Desktop Environment More Powerful, Beautiful And Useful﻿
item.description:
Plasma 5.6 Makes KDE Plasma Desktop Environment More Powerful, Beautiful And Useful﻿

Plasma has always been the talk of the town for its sleek and cutting edge look. KDE Plasma among all other Linux Desktop Environments have always stood out for its continuous development. The latest release of KDE Plasma is 5.6 which includes some new features, tweaks and fixes.

item.title: AMD Open-Sources Compressonator Project - Phoronix
item.description:
AMD Open-Sources Compressonator Project - Phoronix

The latest open-source fruits of AMD's GPUOpen project is the Compressonator. AMD Compressonator is also known formerly as just "AMD Compress" and was a closed-source compression tool available to developers. Compressonator is about compressing textures and creating mip-map levels. The tool is designed around DXTn/S3TC.

item.title: GNOME 3.20.2 Released As Last Update To GNOME 3.20 - Phoronix
item.description:
GNOME 3.20.2 Released As Last Update To GNOME 3.20 - Phoronix

Frederic Peters announced the release today of GNOME 3.20.2 as the second and last planned point release for the GNOME 3.20 series. GNOME 3.20.2 has fixes for NetworkManager, Epiphany, file-roller, GNOME Shell, Mutter, Nautilus, GTK+, and more. Beyond the many bug fixes throughout the stack are also a number of translation updates.

item.title: Streams vs. GBM: The Fight Continues Over NVIDIA's Proposed Wayland Route - Phoronix
item.description:
Streams vs. GBM: The Fight Continues Over NVIDIA's Proposed Wayland Route - Phoronix

It's been over one month since NVIDIA presented their proposed Weston patches for supporting Wayland with NVIDIA's Linux binary driver but the discussion over their proposed approach remains heated. NVIDIA's proposed changes for Wayland compositors has been rather controversial and largely comes down to the current compositors relying upon the GBM (Generic Buffer Manager) versus the approach preferred by NVIDIA of utilizing EGLStreams and friends.

item.title: Intel Loses Another Longtime Open-Source Graphics Driver Developer - Phoronix
item.description:
Intel Loses Another Longtime Open-Source Graphics Driver Developer - Phoronix

When working on the story this week about Intel Is Preparing A Major Restructuring Of Their Graphics Driver, I found out another bit of information worth relaying: a longtime contributor to the Intel Linux graphics driver stack has left the company to focus on a new venture.

item.title: Here are the 10 New Ubuntu 16.04 LTS Features Every Ubuntu User Should Know - Ubuntu Portal
item.description:
Here are the 10 New Ubuntu 16.04 LTS Features Every Ubuntu User Should Know - Ubuntu Portal

Ubuntu 16.04 LTS Codenamed "Xenial Xerus" has arrived. After Six month developments, Canonical officially releases the new Ubuntu 16.04 LTS on April 21, 2016. It now available to download and install on PCs, laptops and netbooks.

item.title: New Self-Paced Online Course Preps SysAdmins for Linux Foundation Advanced Certification
item.description:
New Self-Paced Online Course Preps SysAdmins for Linux Foundation Advanced Certification

The Linux Foundation has launched a new self-paced, online course to help senior Linux sysadmins prepare for the advanced Linux Foundation Certified Engineer (LFCE) exam. The Linux Networking and Administration (LFS211) course gives students access to 40-50 hours of coursework, and more than 50 hands-on labs -- practical experience that translates to real-world situations.
